items.title: Science Says a Longer Commute to Work Is Almost Never Worth the Money
items.description: At a minimum, the opportunity will need to pay 40 percent more for the tradeoff to be worth it.

items.title: Neuroscience Just Discovered a Weird Way to Tell When Someone Is Really Listening to You
items.description: Watching when people blink can help you tell whether you have their attention.

items.title: This 1 Tweak to Your Body Language Makes You Much More Persuasive, Says a Study of 2,000 TED Talks
items.description: How to instantly win people over with some Italian influence.

items.title: Apple’s Leadership Exodus Isn’t a Crisis. It’s Just Smart Transition Planning
items.description: Everyone seems to be leaving Apple, but maybe that’s a good thing.

items.title: Consultants Are the New C-Suite
items.description: Layoffs have sent an elite pool of talent into the consulting world, creating plenty of opportunities for businesses and consultants.
